inaugurate.translation[0].definitions[0]: to hold an official ceremony when someone starts doing an important job in government
On 8 January 1959 de Gaulle was inaugurated as first president of the Fifth Republic.
inaugurate.translation[0].definitions[1]: to open a building or start an organization, event etc for the first time
The Turner Prize was inaugurated in 1984.
inaugurate.translation[0].definitions[2]: if an event inaugurates an important change or period of time, it comes at the beginning of it
The International Trade Agreement inaugurated a period of high economic growth.
inaugurate.translation[1].definitions[0]: to begin a new system, service, project etc
The airline inaugurated its first nonstop flight to Moscow last year.
a billion dollar aid package inaugurated at the economic summit in Paris
inaugurate.translation[1].definitions[1]: to officially celebrate when a person takes up an important position such as that of president, by holding a special ceremony
He is keeping quiet about his budget plans until after he is inaugurated on Jan 7.
